definition: to allow in fresh air/to allow a prisoner out for exercise/to give out information
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Kite-flying is very popular in China.
sentences.chinese: 放風箏在中國很受歡迎。

sentences.english: As is, this wing would be great for kiting or ground handling practice.
sentences.chinese: 正如，這將是永放風箏或地勤的做法很好。

sentences.english: After picnic the children begin to fly kites. Mr. and Mr. Jackson go fishing by the lake.
sentences.chinese: 午餐後孩子們開始放風箏，傑克遜夫婦在湖邊釣魚。

sentences.english: Just when you think that kiting can be for only a board, think again.
sentences.chinese: 正當你認爲放風箏可以只有一板，再想一想。

sentences.english: A child who was flying a kite sensed it in terms of briskness.
sentences.chinese: 一個孩子在放風箏時猛然感到的飛騰。

sentences.english: The prisoners are allowed out for an hour's exercise each day.
sentences.chinese: 犯人每天有一小時的放風時間。

sentences.english: Autumn is a better season to fly kites.
sentences.chinese: 秋天是放風箏的好時節。

sentences.english: The kite is my dearest parents.
sentences.chinese: 放風箏的人便是我至親至愛的雙親。

sentences.english: The kite-flying season has come and you can see kites flying everywhere, in parks.
sentences.chinese: 放風箏的季節到了，公園裏，草地上，風箏隨處可見。

sentences.english: After picnic the children begin to fly kites. Mr. and Mr. Jackson go fishing by the lake.
sentences.chinese: 午餐後孩子們起頭放風箏，傑克遜佳耦在湖邊垂釣。

sentences.english: Then , we flew kites and played cards, went for a walk and climbed mountains.
sentences.chinese: 我們放風箏，還玩了紙牌，爬了山又散了步。

sentences.english: Mike likes flying kites by the bright moonlight at night.
sentences.chinese: 邁克喜好在夜晚敞亮的月光下放風箏。

sentences.english: This is great kite flying weather.
Hisson flew on it back to Japan. There is a K-Day in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 日本有一個風箏節，年輕人們進行放風箏比賽。

sentences.english: You may fly kite or ride a bike in Evergreen Park.
sentences.chinese: 去萬綠園可以放風箏或騎自行車。

sentences.english: Cloud elder sister and the girl is flying a kite, the kite in the Zhao Yaozong Dan tree.
sentences.chinese: 雲姐和丫鬟們放風箏，風箏掛在了趙耀宗丹房的樹上。

definition: to crack down on/to take severe measures against
to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
to try to persuade sb to give up (their job, plans etc)
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
a fish that escaped the net (idiom)/(fig.) sb or sth that slips through the net
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
